Okay, so I’m thinking about how using F might lead to a covering of all Z with overlaps based on periodic mod ℓ. The covering property seems to reduce to something on Z_ℓ only if I think about F modulo ℓ and count multiplicity. For each residue r mod ℓ, the number of representations r = p + f mod ℓ with p in P and f in F is constant, equal to 1. But since F isn’t always reduced mod ℓ uniquely, I’m curious about these contributions.
